abstract.text: The accessory category types supported by HomeKit.

inlineContent.text: property contains one of the values listed below to tell you what the associated accessory does.
Don’t confuse these values with the service types found in

. Despite the similarities, they describe different things. Accessories are the physical objects that the user installs in the home, like a garage door opener. Accessories belong to one of the categories listed here, like
Accessories have one or more services that perform tasks. The garage door opener accessory has a garage door opener service with service type
. The same accessory might also have an attached light providing a light bulb service with service type

abstract.text: Configure, control, and communicate with home automation accessories.
A home automation accessory, like a garage door opener or a thermostat.
A category for a HomeKit accessory.
The category to which this accessory belongs.
An audio receiver accessory that supports HAP and AirPlay2.
The primary unit of living space, typically composed of rooms organized into zones.
The manager for a collection of one or more of a user’s homes.
The service types supported by HomeKit.
